sense.name: a sensational, publicly-known event
sense.examples: The young guitarist has created quite a stir in New York night clubs. Mary regretted the stir she had caused at town meeting last night.

sense.name: an incipient or budding emotion or feeling
sense.examples: Sally felt a stir of anger at John's sarcastic remark. The teenager felt the first stirs of amorous love for the girl next door.

sense.name: detectable activity or motion
sense.examples: At six in the morning there was not a stir in the house. The children enjoy all the stir in the kitchen preparing for Thanksgiving. The postman tiptoed by the sleeping dog without getting a stir from the beast. We saw the first stirs of spring in the small crocuses coming up through the snow.

sense.name: the act of mixing something with an implement
sense.examples: John gave his coffee a quick stir with his finger. The biscuit batter should only have a light stir, don't over beat it. This paint machine does very thorough stirs of the colors added to the base color.

sense.name: being in prison
sense.commentary: STIR[+state][+incarceration][+in_prison] Note: occurs in the phrase 'in stir'
sense.examples: He's doing twenty years in stir for armed robbery.
